tips.title: Use the Rule of Thirds
content: Divide the frame into nine equal parts using two horizontal and two vertical lines. Place important elements along these lines or at their intersections. This will help create a balanced and appealing composition.

tips.title: Create Depth with Foreground and Background
content: Add elements to the foreground, middle ground, and background to create a sense of depth. This will make your photographs three-dimensional and more interesting. Use a wide angle to capture more elements.

tips.title: Leading Lines
content: Look for lines within the frame that direct the viewer's eye to the main subject. These could be roads, rivers, fences, or shadows. Leading lines help create dynamics and guide attention to important elements of the composition.

tips.title: Symmetry and Balance
content: Use symmetry to create a harmonious and balanced composition. Symmetrical frames often look aesthetically pleasing. Also, try to balance the frame by color and shape to make it look stable.

tips.title: Use Framing Within the Frame
content: Look for natural elements that can frame your main subject. These could be arches, windows, tree branches, and other elements. Framing within the frame helps to highlight the main subject and add depth and focus to the shot.
